definition: all roads lead to Rome/use different means to obtain the same result (idiom)
pinyin: tiao2 tiao2 da4 lu4 tong1 Luo2 ma3

definition: strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
gauze/to collect/to gather/to catch/to sift
surname Luo
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: You should not give up though you failed the exam. All roads lead to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 即使你考试失败，也不要气馁，条条大路通罗马。

sentences.english: They say all roads lead to Rome.
Or, simply said, "All roads lead to Rome", the world is one dollar.
sentences.chinese: 或者简单说，“条条大路通罗马”，世界是一元的。

sentences.english: Just as a popular saying goes all roads lead to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 成语“条条大路通罗马”，就是这个意思。

sentences.english: Let bygones be bygones. Snap out of it, all roads lead to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 过去的就让他过去吧，别再想了，条条大路通罗马。

sentences.english: We have the enough reason to believe that all roads lead to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 我们有足够的理由相信条条大路通罗马。

definition: shortcut
(lit.) the road through Yangguan 陽關|阳关[Yang2 guan1]/(fig.) wide open road/bright future
lit. in every trade, a master appears (idiom); fig. You can produce outstanding achievements in any task, provided you put it enough love and diligence
the matter depends on the individual (idiom); it is a matter for your own effort/With effort, one can achieve anything.
this road is blocked/fig. This method does not work./Doing this is no good.
broad and open road (idiom); fig. brilliant future prospects
lit. Mt Zhongnan is a shortcut to a ministerial job (idiom); fig. to take a shortcut to promotion
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
Heaven never bars one's way (idiom); don't despair and you will find a way through./Never give up hope./Never say die.
pinyin: tian1 wu2 jue2 ren2 zhi1 lu4

definition: a really determined person will find a solution (idiom); where there's a will, there's a way
pinyin: you3 zhi4 zhe3 shi4 jing4 cheng2

definition: lit. When we get to the mountain, there'll be a way through. (idiom)/fig. Everything will turn out for the best./Let's worry about it when it happens./It will be all right on the night./cf couplet 車到山前必有路，船到橋頭自然直|车到山前必有路，船到桥头自然直
pinyin: che1 dao4 shan1 qian2 bi4 you3 lu4

definition: all walks of life (idiom)/every trade
there is nothing the determined person can't accomplish (idiom)/persistence will overcome
pinyin: shi4 shang4 wu2 nan2 shi4 , zhi3 pa4 you3 xin1 ren2
related.word: 世上无难事，只怕有心人

definition: to become rich/enrichment
to stick to one's ways/to cling to one's course
pinyin: yi1 tiao2 dao4 zou3 dao4 hei1

definition: lit. a thousand mile journey begins with the first step/fig. big accomplishments come from an accumulation of little achievements made one by one
pinyin: qian1 li3 zhi1 xing2 , shi3 yu2 zu2 xia4
